dtametasa 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Plot a summary ROC plot for dtametasa object

Source: R/sroc.R
sroc.vec.Rd

Plot a single sROC plot

sroc.vec(
  object,
  add = FALSE,
  sroc.col = 1,
  sroc.lty = 1,
  sroc.lwd = 1,
  xlab = "1-specificity",
  ylab = "Sensitivity",
  plot.ci = TRUE,
  ci.level = 0.95,
  sroc.ci.col = "grey48",
  sroc.ci.lwd = 1,
  sroc.ci.lty = 2,
  add.spoint = TRUE,
  spoint.pch = 18,
  spoint.col = 1,
  spoint.cex = 2,
  ...
)

Arguments

object

The object from function dtametasa.fc or dtametasa.rc; or a vector of c(u1, u2, t1, t2, r)
add

Whether to add the plot into an existed plot. Default is FALSE, to create a new plot.
sroc.col

The color of sROC. Default is black.
sroc.lty

The line type of sROC. Default is solid.
sroc.lwd

The line width of sROC. Default is 1, solid.
xlab

The label of x-axis. Default is: 1-specificity.
ylab

The label of y-axis. Default is Sensitivity.
plot.ci

Whether to plot confidence interval of sROC. Default is TRUE, to plot the CI.
ci.level

The significance level of confidence interval of sROC. Default is 0.95
sroc.ci.col

The color of confidence interval of sROC. Default is grey.
sroc.ci.lwd

The line width of confidence interval of sROC. Default is 1.
sroc.ci.lty

The line type of confidence interval of sROC. Default is 2, dashed.
add.spoint

Whether to add the summary point in the sROC plot. Default it not the add.
spoint.pch

The type of the point. Default is 19.
spoint.col

The color of the point. Default is black.
spoint.cex

The size of the point. Default is 1.
...

Other augments in function points or function curve

Value

SROC plot

See also

points, curve, dtametasa.fc, dtametasa.rc.

Examples


sa1 <- dtametasa.fc(IVD, p = 0.7)
sroc.vec(sa1)
